title: Arsenal face competition for £50m PSV striker Donyell Malen who left the Gunners two years ago
text:
Arsenal are ready to fight to bring back highly rated youngster Donyell Malen who left the club for just £200k two years ago.

The Dutch striker was at the club for two years before he was sold to PSV Eindhoven back in 2017.

Now Tuttosport , are reporting that the Gunners are ready to compete with AC Milan and pay €56m to bring the striker back from the Dutch side.

Since he left Arsenal, the 20-year-old has become one of the hottest commodities in Dutch football.

Arsenal are looking to bring back former youth level player Donyell Malen for a reported €56m

He is currently the top scorer in the Eredivisie having scored eight goals in eight league appearances.

Malen joined the Gunners in 2015 from PSV's rivals Ajax.

The youngster became a regular for Arsenal at youth level scoring 27 goals in 67 appearances.

Donyell Malen played for Arsenal between 2015 and 2017 before he was sold to PSV

However maybe surprisingly he was sold to PSV where he first started to become a regular last season, scoring ten goals as the squad narrowly missed out on the Dutch league title to Ajax.

Malen's appearances have impressed Dutch national coach Ronald Koeman enough to give him his debut and he scored his first international goal in a 4-2 victory over Germany in September.
description: The Gunners are looking to bring back Donyell Malen who left the club for the Dutch side in 2017. Malen has starred for PSV since he left and is currently the top scorer in the Eredivisie.
